SEARCH
Package com.mygdx.game

Class JSONHandeler

java.lang.Object
com.mygdx.game.JSONHandeler
public class JSONHandeler extends Object
Custom methods that simplify certain actions for Json. More methods may be added for more functionality. Certain more advanced functions as found in the LibGDX Wiki will need problem specific implementation.
Version:
2.00
Author:
Jack Scott

  • Method Details

    • JSONHandeler

      public void JSONHandeler()
      Creates a new Json and JsonReader for the class.

    • getUsername

      public String getUsername(String username)
      Example for getting values from the user Json. Notes: users.json is a json with a list of objects that stores user data (5 Strings as named below). Takes in a username (Could also be name, init, userType, or saves). And iterates through the Json looking for said username, if found the username is returned (could also be the previously mentioned).
      Parameters:
      username - takes in a username that we seek to find in the list of jsons
      Returns:
      the username if found, or the string ERROR otherwise

    • getSave

      public Save getSave(String username)
      Gets a Save from saves.json based on the entered username or null if username not in json
      Parameters:
      username - used to find associated Save
      Returns:
      a Save Save or null if not found

    • getSaveState

      public SaveState getSaveState(String username)
      Gets a SaveState from saves.json based on the entered username or null if username not in json
      Parameters:
      username - used to find associated SaveState
      Returns:
      a SaveState SaveState or null if not found

    • getSortedScores

      public ArrayList<SaveState> getSortedScores()
      Returns an arraylist of save states sorted from highest score to lowest.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of SaveStates SaveState sorted from greatest score to lowest score

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame(String username, Save save)
      Saves the game by adding/replacing a SaveState in saves.json. (Constructs a new SaveState from inputs) Takes save.json stores it then adds/replaces the new SaveState and overwrites save.json having added/changed the SaveState.
      Parameters:
      username - used to check for exisitng SaveState in saves.json. Also used to construct a new SaveState
      save - used to construct a new SaveState

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame(SaveState saveState)
      Saves the game by adding/replacing a SaveState in saves.json, using the entered SaveState Takes save.json stores it then adds/replaces the new SaveState and overwrites save.json having added/changed the SaveState.
      Parameters:
      saveState - to be added or replace an exisitng SaveState

    • checkUsername

      public Boolean checkUsername(String username)
      Checks if a username is in the users json, returning a boolean
      Parameters:
      username - that we want to find
      Returns:
      true if found, false otherwise
